author: Staff Reporter
text:
Religious ecstasy marked the Hanuman Jayanti celebrations at the famous Anjaneyar Temple here on Saturday as thousands of devotees thronged the temple right from early morning.

Special puja was performed and one lakh and eight ‘vadai maalai’ were adorned to the deity besides performing laksharchanai. Special arrangements were made for the pilgrims and the prasadam were distributed. Later in the day, special puja was performed on the Hanuman idol as devotees from various parts of the State and nearby State thronged the temple premises. The Anjaneyar Temple of which the history is unknown is one of the biggest deities in the State. The main road leading to the temple was closed for traffic and vehicles were diverted through bus stand road. Police personnel along with volunteers were involved in crowd management and also to prevent untoward incidents.

Minister for Industries and Transport P. Thangamani; District Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy; MLAs K.P.P. Baskar, and U. Thaniyarasu; and government officials visited the temple.
title: Heavy rush at Anjaneyar Temple
